name: Titanium.UI.Android
doc:
@platform android 1.0 @editurl https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/edit/master/apidoc/Titanium/UI/Android/Android.yml

The Android-specific UI capabilities. All properties, methods and events in this namespace will only work on Android systems.

Examples

Android Preferences Example

Create preferences interface for the application.

app.js

var button = Ti.UI.createButton({
  title:    'Click to Open Preferences'
});
button.addEventListener('click', function() {
  Ti.UI.Android.openPreferences();
});
Ti.UI.currentWindow.add(button);

platform/android/res/xml/preferences.xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<PreferenceScreen xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:title="Preferences">
  <PreferenceScreen
      android:title="Misc. Preferences"
      android:summary="Click to see more options">
    <EditTextPreference
      android:title="Edit Text Preference"
      android:summary="You may enter a string"
      android:defaultValue=""
      android:key="editText" />
  </PreferenceScreen>
  <PreferenceCategory android:title="Category One">
    <CheckBoxPreference
      android:title="CheckBox Preference"
      android:defaultValue="false"
      android:summary="You may enter a boolean"
      android:key="checkbox" />
    <RingtonePreference
      android:title="Ringtone Preference"
      android:summary="You may pick a ringtone"
      android:defaultValue=""
      android:key="ringtone" />
  </PreferenceCategory>
  <PreferenceCategory android:title="Category Two">
    <ListPreference
      android:title="List Preference"
      android:summary="You may chose from multiple choices"
      android:key="list"
    android:entries="@array/listNames"
    android:entryValues="@array/listValues"
    />
  </PreferenceCategory>
</PreferenceScreen>

platform/android/res/values/array/array.xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<resources>
  <string-array name="listNames">
    <item>5 Minutes</item>
    <item>10 Minutes</item>
    <item>15 Minutes</item>
    <item>30 Minutes</item>
    <item>60 Minutes</item>
  </string-array>
  <string-array name="listValues">
    <item>5</item>
    <item>10</item>
    <item>15</item>
    <item>30</item>
    <item>60</item>
  </string-array>
</resources>

property.name: LINKIFY_ALL
property.doc: Converts all detectable types of data into clickable links.

property.name: OVER_SCROLL_ALWAYS
property.doc:
Always allow a user to over-scroll this view, provided it is a view that can scroll.

@description

Use this with the following properties - Titanium.UI.ScrollableView.overScrollMode, Titanium.UI.ScrollView.overScrollMode, Titanium.UI.TableView.overScrollMode and Titanium.UI.WebView.overScrollMode.

Only applicable when Titanium.Platform.Android.API_LEVEL is 9 or above.

@platform android 3.1.0
property.shortDoc: Always allow a user to over-scroll this view, provided it is a view that can scroll. ...

property.name: OVER_SCROLL_IF_CONTENT_SCROLLS
property.doc:
Allow a user to over-scroll this view only if the content is large enough to meaningfully scroll, provided it is a view that can scroll.

@description

Use this with the following properties - Titanium.UI.ScrollableView.overScrollMode, Titanium.UI.ScrollView.overScrollMode, Titanium.UI.TableView.overScrollMode and Titanium.UI.WebView.overScrollMode.

Only applicable when Titanium.Platform.Android.API_LEVEL is 9 or above.

@platform android 3.1.0
property.shortDoc: Allow a user to over-scroll this view only if the content is large enough to meaningfully scroll, provided it is a vi...

property.name: OVER_SCROLL_NEVER
property.doc:
Never allow a user to over-scroll this view.

@description

Use this with the following properties - Titanium.UI.ScrollableView.overScrollMode, Titanium.UI.ScrollView.overScrollMode, Titanium.UI.TableView.overScrollMode and Titanium.UI.WebView.overScrollMode.

Only applicable when Titanium.Platform.Android.API_LEVEL is 9 or above.

@platform android 3.1.0
property.shortDoc: Never allow a user to over-scroll this view. ...

property.name: SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_PAN
property.doc:
Pan the current heavyweight window when the input method (ie software keyboard) is shown, to ensure that its contents are not obscured.

@description

Used with the Titanium.UI.Window.windowSoftInputMode property.

One of the group of soft input adjustment constants, SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_UNSPECIFIED, SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_RESIZE, and SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_PAN.
property.shortDoc:
Pan the current heavyweight window when the input method (ie software keyboard) is shown, to
ensure that its contents...

property.name: SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_RESIZE
property.doc:
Resize the current heavyweight window when the input method (ie software keyboard) is shown, to ensure that its contents are not obscured.

@description

Used with the Titanium.UI.Window.windowSoftInputMode property.

One of the group of soft input adjustment constants, SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_UNSPECIFIED, SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_RESIZE, and SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_PAN.
property.shortDoc:
Resize the current heavyweight window when the input method (ie software keyboard) is shown,
to ensure that its conte...

property.name: SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_UNSPECIFIED
property.doc:
Use the system-default behavior to determine how the soft input area (ie software keyboard) is accomodated by the current heavyweight window when it receives focus (default.)

@description

Depends on the AndroidManifest.xml setting if defined or system-default otherwise to determine how to accomodate the soft keyboard when visible.

Used with the Titanium.UI.Window.windowSoftInputMode property.

One of the group of soft input adjustment constants, SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_UNSPECIFIED, SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_RESIZE, and SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_PAN.
property.shortDoc:
Use the system-default behavior to determine how the soft input area (ie software keyboard)
is accomodated by the cur...

property.name: SOFT_INPUT_STATE_ALWAYS_HIDDEN
property.doc:
Always hide the soft input area (ie software keyboard) when the current heavyweight window receives focus.

@description

Note that the unresolved bug #7115 on the Official Android Project website affects this functionality.

Used with the Titanium.UI.Window.windowSoftInputMode property.

One of the group of soft input visibility constants, SOFT_INPUT_STATE_ALWAYS_HIDDEN, SOFT_INPUT_STATE_ALWAYS_VISIBLE, SOFT_INPUT_STATE_HIDDEN, SOFT_INPUT_STATE_UNSPECIFIED, and SOFT_INPUT_STATE_VISIBLE.
property.shortDoc:
Always hide the soft input area (ie software keyboard) when the current heavyweight window
receives focus. ...

property.name: SOFT_INPUT_STATE_ALWAYS_VISIBLE
property.doc:
Always show the soft input area (ie software keyboard) when the current heavyweight window receives focus.

@description

Used with the Titanium.UI.Window.windowSoftInputMode property.

This constant is one of the group of soft input visibility constants, SOFT_INPUT_STATE_ALWAYS_HIDDEN, SOFT_INPUT_STATE_ALWAYS_VISIBLE, SOFT_INPUT_STATE_HIDDEN, SOFT_INPUT_STATE_UNSPECIFIED, and SOFT_INPUT_STATE_VISIBLE.
property.shortDoc:

receives focus. ...

property.shortDoc:
Attempt to hide the soft input area (ie software keyboard) when the current heavyweight
window receives focus. ...

property.name: SOFT_INPUT_STATE_UNSPECIFIED
property.doc:

@description

property.shortDoc:
Use the system-default behavior to determine whether to show the soft input area
(ie software keyboard) when the curr...

property.doc:
Attempt to show the soft input area (ie software keyboard) when the current heavyweight window receives focus.

@description

This constant is one of the group of soft input visibility constants, SOFT_INPUT_STATE_ALWAYS_HIDDEN, SOFT_INPUT_STATE_ALWAYS_VISIBLE, SOFT_INPUT_STATE_HIDDEN, SOFT_INPUT_STATE_UNSPECIFIED, and SOFT_INPUT_STATE_VISIBLE.
property.shortDoc:
Attempt to show the soft input area (ie software keyboard) when the current heavyweight

property.name: WEBVIEW_LOAD_CACHE_ELSE_NETWORK
property.doc:
Use with WebView.cacheMode to override how the cache is used in a web view.

@description

Use cached resources when they're available, even when they're expired. Otherwise load resources via network.

@platform android 3.2.0
property.shortDoc: Use with WebView.cacheMode to override how the cache is used in a web view. ...

property.name: WEBVIEW_LOAD_CACHE_ONLY
property.doc:
Use with WebView.cacheMode to override how the cache is used in a web view.

@description

Don't use network, load from the cache only.

@platform android 3.2.0
property.shortDoc: Use with WebView.cacheMode to override how the cache is used in a web view. ...

property.name: WEBVIEW_LOAD_DEFAULT
property.doc:
Use with WebView.cacheMode to override how the cache is used in a web view.

@description

This is the default cache usage mode.

@platform android 3.2.0
property.shortDoc: Use with WebView.cacheMode to override how the cache is used in a web view. ...

property.name: WEBVIEW_LOAD_NO_CACHE
property.doc:
Use with WebView.cacheMode to override how the cache is used in a web view.

@description

Don't use cache, load from the network.

@platform android 3.2.0
property.shortDoc: Use with WebView.cacheMode to override how the cache is used in a web view. ...

property.name: WEBVIEW_PLUGINS_OFF
property.doc:
Use with WebView.pluginState to disable plugins in a web view.

@description

Content that requires a plugin, such as Flash Player, is not loaded, and any alternative content is displayed instead.
property.shortDoc: Use with WebView.pluginState to disable plugins in a web view. ...

property.name: WEBVIEW_PLUGINS_ON
property.doc:
Use with WebView.pluginState to enable plugins in a web view.

@description

Content that requires a plugin, such as Flash Player, is always loaded, whether or not a plugin is available for the content.
property.shortDoc: Use with WebView.pluginState to enable plugins in a web view. ...

property.name: WEBVIEW_PLUGINS_ON_DEMAND
property.doc:
Display a placeholder and only load plugins when user selects it.

@description

Content that requires a plugin, such as Flash Player, is replaced by a placeholder. When the user clicks on the placeholder, the plugin is loaded and the content is displayed.

Use with WebView.pluginState to load plugins on demand.
property.shortDoc: Display a placeholder and only load plugins when user selects it. ...

property.name: apiName
property.doc:
The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to.

@description

The value of this property is the fully qualified name of the API. For example, Button returns Ti.UI.Button.

@platform android 3.2.0 @platform blackberry 3.2.0 @platform iphone 3.2.0 @platform ipad 3.2.0 @platform mobileweb 3.2.0
property.shortDoc: The name of the API that this proxy corresponds to. ...

property.name: bubbleParent
property.doc:
Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent.

@description

Some proxies (most commonly views) have a relationship to other proxies, often established by the add() method. For example, for a button added to a window, a click event on the button would bubble up to the window. Other common parents are table sections to their rows, table views to their sections, and scrollable views to their views. Set this property to false to disable the bubbling to the proxy's parent.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0
property.shortDoc: Indicates if the proxy will bubble an event to its parent. ...

property.name: lifecycleContainer
property.doc:
The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy.

@description

If this property is set to a Window or TabGroup, then the corresponding Activity lifecycle event callbacks will also be called on the proxy. Proxies that require the activity lifecycle will need this property set to the appropriate containing Window or TabGroup.

@platform android 3.6.0
property.shortDoc: The Window or TabGroup whose Activity lifecycle should be triggered on the proxy. ...

method.name: addEventListener
method.doc: Adds the specified callback as an event listener for the named event.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to invoke when the event is fired.

method.shortDoc: Adds the specified callback as an event listener for the named event. ...

method.name: applyProperties
method.doc:
Applies the properties to the proxy.

@description

Properties are supplied as a dictionary. Each key-value pair in the object is applied to the proxy such that myproxy[key] = value.

params.name: props
params.doc:
A dictionary of properties to apply.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform blackberry 3.3.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0 @platform mobileweb 3.0.0

method.shortDoc: Applies the properties to the proxy. ...

method.name: hideSoftKeyboard
method.doc:
Hides the soft keyboard.

@description

Be aware that it is not currently possible in the native Android API to detect that the keyboard is already visible or to globally show the keyboard.

method.name: openPreferences
method.doc:
Opens an application preferences dialog, using the native Android system settings interface, defined by the platform-specific preferences.xml and array.xml files.

@description

The preferences configuration files must be created in the project folders, platform/android/res/xml/preferences.xml and platform/android/res/values/array/array.xml.

See the example for a demonstration, and the official Android Developer documentation for the preferences.xml format.
method.shortDoc:
Opens an application preferences dialog, using the native Android system settings interface,
defined by the platform-...

method.name: removeEventListener
method.doc:
Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event.

@description

Multiple listeners can be registered for the same event, so the callback parameter is used to determine which listener to remove.

When adding a listener, you must save a reference to the callback function in order to remove the listener later:

var listener = function() { Ti.API.info("Event listener called."); }
window.addEventListener('click', listener);

To remove the listener, pass in a reference to the callback function:

window.removeEventListener('click', listener);

params.name: callback
params.doc: Callback function to remove. Must be the same function passed to addEventListener.

method.shortDoc: Removes the specified callback as an event listener for the named event. ...

method.doc: Sets the value of the bubbleParent property.

params.doc:
New value for the property.

@platform android 3.0.0 @platform iphone 3.0.0 @platform ipad 3.0.0

method.shortDoc: Sets the value of the bubbleParent property. ...

method.shortDoc: Sets the value of the lifecycleContainer property. ...
